sentences.english: No matter how steadfast the upper half is , it just can't defeat the weakness of the lower half.
sentences.chinese: 他上半身多么坚贞，也敌不过下半身的软弱。

sentences.english: Your look's so faithful, so brave…as you feel our common pain.
sentences.chinese: 你满脸坚贞，满脸无畏，一如你感受到我们共同的痛。

sentences.english: No matter what punishment the enemy handed out to him , he stood as firm as ever.
sentences.chinese: 无论敌人对他施加什么刑法，他始终坚贞不屈。

sentences.english: From now aboard, she is that in feedback to junior lofty school's maximum faithful empress.
sentences.chinese: 从此，她就是那应国中最坚贞的皇后。

sentences.english: Man is constant in the face of death.
sentences.chinese: 人在死亡面前是坚贞不屈的。

sentences.english: More faithful love, or is still real destruction.
sentences.chinese: 再坚贞的爱情，还是抵不过现实的摧残。

sentences.english: Love asks faith, and faith firmness .
sentences.chinese: 爱情贵忠诚，史诚能坚贞。

sentences.english: I want you so, true like ice, true like fire.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你也一样，赤诚似火，坚贞如冰。

sentences.english: My heart was no waves, like young firmness just a dream.
sentences.chinese: 我心居然再无波澜，好像年少的坚贞只是一场梦。

sentences.english: The value of love lies in faithfulness and unyieldingness instead of high position.
sentences.chinese: 爱情的价值不在于高位，而在于坚贞。

sentences.english: The solidness of her faith gave her enduring hope.
sentences.chinese: 她对忠诚的坚贞不二给了她长久的希望。

sentences.english: He remained unbending under the severest of tortures.
sentences.chinese: 他受尽酷刑，仍然坚贞不屈。

sentences.english: Love ask faith, and faith firmness.
sentences.chinese: 爱情贵忠诚，史诚能坚贞。

sentences.english: He remains faithful to the ideals of the party until his death.
sentences.chinese: 他对党的信念至死坚贞不渝。

sentences.english: A compact but extremely sturdy design for high pressure-temperature service.
sentences.chinese: 布局紧凑，很是坚贞，合用于高压高温应用规模。

sentences.english: Survival and new growth ultimately depend on one little hobbit and his stalwart friends.
sentences.chinese: 生存和发展都要靠侏儒和他的那些坚贞不渝的朋友们。

definition: unswerving in one's loyalty (idiom); faithful and constant
ready to die to preserve one's chastity
one's character/fret (on fingerboard of lute or guitar)
love is more solid than gold (idiom)
faithful unto death (i.e. Confucian ban on widow remarrying)
